page.title: 02LECHLADE ON THAMES
page.content: The{River Thames}passes through Lechlade. It is wide and twisty and a big tourist attraction. There are boats on the River all day and you can hire them from the riverside which used to be a warehouse for Thames barges which used to carry coal and wool. There is a huge free car park and there are walks along the riverbank past fishermen to{St. John's {Lock}or the{Roundhouse}where the Thames meets the{Coln}and {Thames-Severn Canal.}Water is piped from the Coln to{Buscot Water Works and distributed to{Faringdon.}There are seven public houses, restaurants and tea rooms in Lechlade and many antique and craft shops to browse around. This ancient market town is a popular{residential area,}with many people working in London, Swindon, Cirencester and places far and wide.
